content.text: The user ID has a negative balance in his STREAM wallet as per screenshot below:
Please clarify why that happened and how to fix the issue/balance.

fields.summary: PROD - Negative balance in a STREAM wallet

content.text: Given the date, it seems due to commit operations at the beginning of the feature launch.
as you worked with Stavros on this, you are probably the best candidate to investigate.
I solved the issue that was causing the negative balance issue and it was deployed on Prod so no one else will encounter this problem.
But how we should proceed with restoring the right balance?
The customer tried to retrieve his Streams but got charged once more time - so w need to top his balance with:
But how to proceed with existing Transfers and transactions?

content.text: User ID 385 ATS AMBASSADOR TRADING SYSTEM LTD
After the App crashed this morning, and since it has been up and running again, the client above has been facing issues instructing in-app payments. This is the error:

2024-10-30 09:16:18.650292Z: [SEVERE] Error on Provider: AutoDisposeFutureProvider<({CustomerEntity customer, Map<DateTime, List<TransactionEntity>> transactions, WalletEntity wallet})>#e02fe(UYCINIPD)

content.text: we cannot read anything from the logs related to this, it seems a mobile app problem.
can you confirm customer is on the latest version fo the app?
no trace of this in serverside logs, can you please check sentry and report in?

content.text: User ID 1767 ZERO ONE R.M. Ltd
After the App crashed this morning, and since it has been up and running again, the client above has been facing issues instructing in-app payments. This is the error:

2024-10-30 09:16:19.600605Z: [SEVERE] Error on Provider: AutoDisposeFutureProvider<({CustomerEntity customer, Map<DateTime, List<TransactionEntity>> transactions, WalletEntity wallet})>#35160(SVDW5UWZ)

Response(500): {"status":"INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR","message":"Could not roll back JPA transaction; nested exception is org.hibernate.TransactionException: Unable to rollback against JDBC Connection","errors":["error"]}

fields.summary: PROD - Client unable to instruct in-app payments (ZERO ONE)

content.text: this error is on “getting the list of transactions on the account”, not on “executing transactions”.
Are we sure the customer cannot instruct payments?
one way of validating this would be opening the transactions lists for account 856 in backoffice and see if this causes any issue
This is also apparently working again so ticket can be closed if no further investigation or fix has to be done.
I think this ticket can be closed, like the other one.

content.text: balance changes logs for this user from the 29th to today:
as mentioned on the stand up the receiver’s balance is updated correctly, hence the actual balance takes the duplicated transaction into account.
I have manually done the transfer from ZERO ONE back to the client and the balance of the client has gone back to zero.

issuetype.description: Funzioni espresse sotto forma di obiettivi dell’utente.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: Il link principale è disponibile solo per utenti Jira Premium.

content.text: The need is to have a report every week for the merchants with the following fields if possible
We would like to contact them to explain all present and future toonie opportunities and services
it would be helpful to have a list updated each month
ideal have dashboard for monitoring this in real time…

fields.summary: List of Toonie users for marketing

content.text:
select c2.id as company_id, p.id , x."name", p."name" , c.surname , locale, c.prefix , c.mobile_number, c.email, c.receive_quid_news, y.use, y.address_line1, y.address_line2, y.city, y.postal_code, y.state, y.country, p.created --, y.*--,a.* -- ,* 
from party.customer c 
join party.company_customer cc on cc.customer_id = c.id 
join party.company c2 on cc.company_id = c2.id
join party.party p on p.id = c.id 
join (
	select co.id as ida, *
	from party.party pa 
	join party.company co on pa.id = co.id 
) as x on x.ida = c2.id
left join (select distinct on (2) pax.id, 
		   pax.party_id as p_id,
		   * from party.party_address pax join party.address a on a.id = pax.address_id  order by 2,
		   a.created DESC ) as y  on c2.id = y.p_id
and this is the resulting CSV:

content.text: As reported yesterday on Slack, since some users are facing issues instructing in-App payments
because of unscrollable screen and warning message being too big and not showing the continue button in the screenshot below:
Please make the following changes as agreed:
Reduce text size of the warning message
Change the text to a shorter version, which should be:
English: The destination wallet must be in the same currency of your wallet
Italian: Il wallet di destinazione deve essere nella stessa valuta del tuo wallet
French: Le portefeuille de destination doit être dans la même devise que votre portefeuille
German: Die Ziel-Brieftasche muss dieselbe Währung haben wie Ihre Brieftasche

fields.summary: PROD - change payments screen to fix instructing payments issue

content.text: Tested in demo Android and all works ok now
Fixed issues with scrolling when the text is too big and reduced the text size by a couple of values

content.text: The user above is unable to instruct an in-app payment towards AIVAR INTL TECHNOLOGIES LIMITED.
The wallets of both users are enabled.
The user is saying that as soon as the beneficiary (AIVAR) is selected, the message in the screenshot below appears and there is no yellow button to proceed with the payment.
As you can also see from the screenshot, the App is in French.
Please clarify what the issue is and how it can be fixed.

fields.summary: PROD - User cannot instruct an in-App payment

content.text: , I’ve checked the logic in the page and the button should be under the warning. The warning message says that the currency of the payment session must be the same as the wallet’s currency and that currency conversion is not supported. There’s no logic to hide the button

Don’t know if it’s the case but because the text seems slightly bigger than the standard it could be that the space covered by the text pushes the button down in the page, decreasing the text size could probably help with the issue making it partially visible.
If there are any adjustments that you would prefer like removing the warning icon or something else i’ll work on it
can you check the last comment from Michele? Thanks
all that is needed has been agreed (and already done I believe) in this ticket:
let me know when you have released the new App version.
I’ve tested this in demo and it’s working fine now,
is closed hence I’m closing this one too. Please open it again if needed.
The customer was instructed to try again once the new version of the App has been released in the Stores.

2024-10-16 21:41:04	
(no unique labels)

this is a side effect of removing currencies
a customer has already opened a wallet, decision that was taken this year after the meetings with the US banks that didn' twant to see crypto within Toonie.

will update on the status of this implementation
still on testing phase, our goal is to have it deployed on monday

I’ve managed to complete the FX BTC to Eur succesfully today
The issue you faced yesterday is related to daily limit, I will tell Frontend to handle this
we had to perform a hotfix on this or this change might have affected account opening.
If you guys have time to do a further check, good, otherwise I’ll test it myself whilst deploying in few minutes in production.

content.text: Need to add management for the new Wallester provider.
The endpoints that need to be looked at/modified/added are:
cards/v1/pan/security/settigs - get the public key to see the pan info
cards/v1/pan/cards/{cardId} + body with encrypted public key - get the pan info regarding the card
cards/v1/pan/cards/{cardId}/pin + body with encrypted public key - get the pin code
order a new prepaid card (endpoint + UI needed)
load/unload money to/from prepaid card (probably endpoint + UI needed)
prepaid card transaction summary (needs to be clarified if possible)
Transaction types different from one provider to another: some represent the same operations even thought they’re written with different terminology (possible new UI needed for new transaction types)

fields.summary: Add Wallester management for prepaid card flow

content.text: about what needs to be implemented mobile-side and started working on the new endpoints
Worked on setting up properly the endpoints to fetch the pan info of the gift card
Worked on fetching the pan info for the card, found some issues with the response decryption
Worked on testing the fetch pin code endpoint but found some issues with the provider. Worked on setting up the pan info screen with the new endpoint
Worked on preparing the release of the updated flow. Fetch pin code endpoint is not working currently, replaced missing value with placeholder
Worked on adjusting the fetch pan info endpoint with the recent fixes from BE
Worked on some fixes and had some calls regarding the updated flow that needs to be implemented
Worked on implementing the missing endpoints
Worked on adjust the transaction types and transaction fields from the response
Adjusted some endpoints and return types for the new flow

content.text: Hi Luca please can you check the flow of this customer in toonie he user is Slavomir Cernak customer ID 14520

as you can see from the image, he has multiple contract in the BO, the new fix that was deployed, any new customer that fails GBG 3rd attempt, we take the last attempt and upload the last picture captured by gbg, and create only one contract for the wallet full

fields.summary: Prod - Multiple contract for Wallet full

content.text: After a series of checks the user was able to "start" the OnBoarding process several times. The process does not present anomalies compared to what was designed and developed. I believe that the problem is the application that started the onboarding process several times.
Do you have any ideas on how this could be possible? Can you tell me what rule allows the start of the "complete KYC" both from the first login and from the "menu" section of the application?

once a new user is registered it’s part of the standard flow to ask him if he would like to complete the KYC flow too or just continue using the app normally, in case he refuses he’ll be able to complete it from the menu section but if he has already completed it the first time after registering himself as a new user he shouldn’t be able to do it again
hi guys, we need to check if there is a bug allowed the customer to start the KYC flow again multiple times
, there’s not much i can do from my side especially because this issue was found in a PROD account, don’t know if maybe
can check on a deeper level on this
could you check the rules that allow the customer to do the KYC flow?
The user is enabled to do the KCY flow only when the WalletFull contract has status COMPLETED and  the KYC hasn’t been sent for approval to the BO
we are seeing some more cases of multiple tasks
take this as an example, the user KUTSELEPA (ID

) has 3 identity tasks in the BO, and 3 contracts for the full KYC, the first 2 were cancelled, the last one is pending, since the last fix, we avoided to create multiple contracts, not sure what has been changed to trigger this abnormal flow again.
similar case with Sara Pereira Garcia 14710
both users have only one transaction in GBG IDscan, however, in GBG ID3 global, there are multiple transactions for the same user, see example of the user

i was able to reproduce the issue in demo with the user 3908. The error seems to be due to a strange behavior of the application. If you get a selfie error, it asks for another one. Also, if you press the "back" button while it has completed loading the selfie, it creates a double contract.
I created a workaround on the API side, I will discuss it tomorrow with
It is possibile avoid the back button if some API call is running.
Check logs, process, test an onboarding.

issuetype.description: Un problema o un errore.
issuetype.name: Bug

nonEditableReason.message: Il link principale è disponibile solo per utenti Jira Premium.

content.text: have both approved the below payment in Toonie (Toonie ID 127497) for Eur 14,900.00
This withdrawal was then duplicated in Quid (one was rejected by BO and one approved)
Please investigate as this should not be happening still

fields.summary: PROD - Duplicated Toonie withdrawal in Quid

content.text: Hi This is priority 1 as its not the first time. We cannot allow for duplicate withdrawals for any of the companies. Please investigate and update why this has happened again. This is a major risk to the business
We believe, it’s actually the first time that this happens this way. The solution that was put in place before was done with reliance on the fact that:
Backoffice operators would not try to cicumvent the “disabling” of the button
One backoffice operator at a time would take care of approving transactions (as disabling buttons in these cases was a UI solution, and not a systematic solution)

We haven’t been able to validate this yet, but according to the team that’s what happened, they clicked on the same approve button in the couple of seconds span that it takes to communicate between toonie → quid → cc (and back).

We can put a systematic solution in place at toonie level but there’s no easy way for QUID to detect if payments are duplicates of this type or identical transfers for the same amounts genuinely instructed, if not by sharing a unique ID that Toonie will generate and QUID will ensure that is “unique” every time.

Currently, our proposal is to lock the payment the instant in which the button in clicked by the operator, preventing anybody else to potentially progress and “resubmit” to quid, whilst the system is negotiating the first payment request with quid itself.
thanks for that and think that with all that happened last week with CC and Quid Ch we wanted to get the payments out asap to the clients who have waiting.
To proposal to lock sounds good once it is clicked
can you check if this is implemented what are the potential issues.
My only concern with duplicate withdrawals is the risk to the business and financial costs. We need to just safeguard this from happened (in all scenarios) with whatever means possible.
the change would be at Toonie level right? Would the user get an error if tried to approve a payment that is already locked? Would this cause any delay in the communication between Toonie and Quid?

, we approved at the same time the same withdrawal in Toonie. One was received correctly, the other attempt got a 400 error. Only 1 moved to Quid for approval hence it looks like the fix works fine. Thanks
